result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael F Bender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Original filed in 13CM466

Defendant Michael F Bender in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Michael F Bender in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-26, 13CF-427 and 13CM-466.

10:43 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court received the report from the agent.
Both parties received their copy of the report as well.
There is no reason why the Defendant should not be sentenced today.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, makes sentencing recommendations. 209 days jail credit.
Atty Renc addresses the Court, requests 209 days jail, concurrent
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court reviews the files. 

BY THE COURT:
13CM-466:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 270 Days
209 Days jail credit
Sentence is satisfied

13CM-466:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 180 Days concurrent to Count 1 
209 Days jail credit
Sentence is satisfied

13CF-427:
Count 3:
Jail sentence for 270 Days concurrent to 13CM-466
209 Days jail credit
Sentence is satisfied

14CF-26:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 270 Days, concurrent to 13CM-466 and 13CF-427
209 Days jail credit
Sentence is satisfied
Court grants civil judgment in favor of the victims for $700 and $800
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 2, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 17, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael F Bender in court with attorney Sheila J. Kessler. Defendant Michael F Bender in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are: 13CM-466, 13CF-427 and 14CF-26.

8:38 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

These are set for a plea.
There is a plea agreement:
13CM-466: Defendant will enter pleas to both counts. 
13CF-427: Defendant will enter a plea to Ct 3. Rest would be dismissed and read in
14CF-26: Defendant will enter a plea to Ct 1. Rest would be dismissed and read in

Joint recommendation: withheld, 24 mo prob, 22 day jail, 22 day credit, time served, ft empt/school combo, abs sob, alco, drugs, aoda and comply, no cont with graffidi's, S.H. only allowed at disrection, restitution, 30 days to get number, pay costs. 

Atty Kessler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 13CM-466 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 13CM-466 Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 13CF-427 Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-26 Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CM-466 Count 1: 946.41(1)  
13CM-466 Count 2: 450.11(7)(h)
13CF-427 Count 3: 946.49(1)(a)
13CF-427 Count 1, Count 2 and Count 4: Dismissed and read in
14CF-26 Count 1: 943.01(1)
14CF-26 Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4: Dismissed and read in

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing. State has complied with victim notification.
Atty Kessler addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
13CM-466:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Jail sentence of 22 Days
Jail credit of 22 Days, time served sentence
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
AODA Assessment and comply with any recommendations
No contact with Graffidi's
No contact with Samantha Hintz unless approved and allowed by the discretion of the agent
Pay restitution. Amount is to be determined within 30 days
Pay costs
Do not pay the DNA Surcharge

Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Do not pay the DNA Surcharge

13CF-427:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 13CM-466
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CM-466
Pay costs
Do not pay the DNA Surcharge

14CF-26:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 13CM-466 and 13CF-427
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CM-466 and 13CF-427
Pay costs
Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA Surcharge
Plea hearing on January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State files information.
Atty Kessler received a copy of the information, waives reading. Defendant will stand mute.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. 

Bond is ordered continued.

Defendant Michael F Bender in court with attorney Sheila J. Kessler. Defendant Michael F Bender in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:27 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Kessler states that she has not had time to discuss the proposal with her client. Takes a moment to do so.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Atty Kessler files a written waiver.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Parties will continue to arraignment.

  Plea hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael F Bender in court with attorney Sheila J. Kessler. Defendant Michael F Bender in CUSTODY. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

3:26 p.m.  Court calls  case.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint. 
Atty Kessler indicates that she had not had the criminal complaint at the earlier hearing but was able to review the criminal complaint with 
her client at the jail.
Atty Kessler makes statements regarding amending the bond.
Atty Kessler would like bond amended to $2,000 cash bond with $500 being paid up front and the remaining balance to be paid by
wage assignment with $50 bi-weekly installments.  Bond has been posted on 13CF427 file.
Defendant make statements regarding his address listed.
State responds to the bond modification on 13CF26.
Atty Cousins objects to the bond modification at this time and makes statements on the record.
Atty Kessler makes statements regarding the defendants residence.
Court questions Atty Kessler if defendant has a written statement from employer to verify his employment.

BY THE COURT:  
Atty Kessler needs to provide to the Clerk of Court's office verification of employment for the defendant and provide a copy to Atty Cousins;
Once this provided then Court will approve and bond will be modified to $500 cash up front and then wage assignment to be paid in the amount of $50 bi-weekly until $4,500.00 remaining balance paid.

Preliminary Hearing set for January 21, 2014 at 3:00 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael F Bender appeared by video. Attorney Sheila J. Kessler in court. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant indicates he has not received a coyp of the complaint. 
Court will continue until 3:00 today.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Court calls case at  1:30 p.m.

Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Resist/Obstruct, Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
State requests a $5000 cash bond:   Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.   Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License. Comply with conditions of bond in pending cases.
